description: Erection of a three bedroom, two storey end of terrace house adjacent to 104 Raleigh Road with associated off street parking and bin storage
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ([Design and Access Statement], [Unnumbered Location Plan], [Energy Statement], [1B], [1C], [1], [4], [5], [6], Received: 23/10/2020, [4A], Received: 14/12/2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  
No materials or other construction deliveries or collections shall take place at the site outside of these hours.  
Any vehicles that are used on site as part of the construction shall have their wheels cleaned of all mud before they leave the site and the resulting debris and run-off shall not be discharged on to the adjoining footway or carriageway.  
The developer shall monitor the condition of the adjoining highway before and after each delivery and/or collection and the carriageway shall be cleaned immediately if any vehicle involved in these activities sheds mud on to the public highway or pavement, removing all such debris to a collection point within the development site.  
No work shall start on site before measures are put in place in to protect the adjoining carriageway and footway from damage.  
No site lighting shall be used that sheds light beyond the boundaries of the site, and measures shall be put in place to suppress dust generation during dry weather.
Condition : 4 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in all respects in accordance with the details submitted under application: 00921/104/P5(4-12), approved on 17/06/2019.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (as amended), or any order revoking or re-enacting that order, no alteration, enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected or allowed to grow within the areas of these splays on land within the approved development site.

Condition : 7 - Before first occupation of the buildings hereby approved, full details (including manufacturer's specification) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles per residential flat) for the occupants of the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (WestTRANS) in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 8 - Before the dwellings hereby approved are first occupied, the developer shall provide to each dwelling a green box container and any other type of containers required at the time of development for household use for the storage and collection of recyclable materials for the purposes of the Council's kerbside recycling service together with the a refuse storage bin all to the specification then in use by the local authority's recycling collection service (or to such other specification as shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority) and shall notify the Council's refuse and recycling services when the development is first occupied.  The waste and recyclable materials containers shall be stored in a proprietary refuse bin enclosure designed for the purpose to be supplied by the developer and located adjacent to each dwelling in the location shown on the approved plans. Each dwelling with a private garden shall also be supplied with a garden waste composting bin of at least 220 litres capacity at the same time.

Condition : 9 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved materials details meeting the following standards:
- At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
- At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
- No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in all respects in accordance with the details submitted under application: 00921/104/P5(4-12), approved on 17/06/2019. 

b) Prior to first occupation of the development evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 11 - Prior to occupation of the hereby approved development, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers' literature) demonstrating that the development of that phase has been constructed to achieve an internal water consumption by the development not exceeding 105 litres/person/day in line with The Water Efficiency Calculator for new dwellings issued by the Ministry for Housing, Communities and Local Government, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 12 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in all respects in accordance with the details submitted under application: 00921/104/P5(4-12), approved on 17/06/2019.

Condition : 13 - The house hereby approved shall be used solely as a single family house (Use Class C3) and shall not be used for business purposes and or as a house in multiple occupation, including any use within Class C4 of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.

Condition : 14 - Before the development is occupied, a 600 mm high front wall shall be erected in front of the forecourt, as shown on the approved drawing 1A, and a pedestrian gate, of at least 1.2 metres in width, shall be provided within the wall directly in front of the entrances of the houses.
